intro: Missiessya mutabilis, commonly known as the ever-changing flower, is a unique species of flowering plant native to the United States. It is characterized by its ability to change color throughout its blooming cycle, typically starting with white petals and transitioning to shades of pink, red, and even purple. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is known for its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. Missiessya mutabilis thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Its striking color transformation makes it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
